conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, interior volumes, and an elevated/isometric viewing angle with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and multi-face wall geometry; good cutaway and readable room volumes. Minor simplification/softness in some wall intersections/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and major adjacency match (kitchen/living left, bedroom top-right, bath/core center-right, stair run along right, entry bottom-right). Some deviations in exact wall/partition lengths and several openings (doors/windows) appear simplified or not precisely located compared to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (bed, sofa/TV blocks, dining/kitchen massing). Bathroom fixtures are simplified/less explicit than in 2D; kitchen detailing is minimal.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean monochrome render with good readability of walls/floors and no UI/text clutter. Lighting is adequate though some areas blend due to uniform material, reducing opening/edge contrast.

detected_errors.description: Door/window openings are simplified and do not all clearly match the 2D plan positions/orientations.
Minor-to-moderate proportional drift in some interior partitions (core/bath/closet area) versus the 2D plan, though overall topology remains consistent.
Bathroom and kitchen elements are under-specified compared to the 2D plan (fixtures/cabinet runs not fully represented).

summary: A true 3D cutaway with strong overall layout fidelity, but with simplified/mismatched openings and some proportional drift in interior partitions and fixtures.
